description: The Northwest Front is a U.S. white supremacist group founded by neo-Nazi Harold Covington in 2009. The Northwest Front seeks to bring about the destruction of the U.S. government and establish an independent state for white supremacists in the Pacific Northwest, a goal known as the "Northwest Imperative" or "Northwest Territorial Imperative." In the early 1970s, Covington joined the U.S. Army and later lived in South Africa and Rhodesia (now Zimbabwe) when both countries were governed by racist white-rule regimes.  After Covingtons death in 2018, the Southern Poverty Law Center assessed that the group was likely to become defunct.

The Fraternal Order of Alt Knights is a violent right-wing group led by white supremacist Kyle Chapman, who uses the alias "Based Stickman." The group was formed as a tactical arm of the Proud Boys and is known for accelerating violence against counterprotestors at right-wing events and rallies. In November 2020, FOAK officially split from the Proud Boys after Chapman was unsuccessful in taking over the group from its current leader, Enrique Tarrio.

The Green Brigade was an eco-fascist affiliate of the Base with international membership. Founded as an independent organization in 2019, the group aligned with the Base by 2019 and became defunct in early 2020. The Green Brigade began on Discord, an encrypted online messaging platform, and its founder(s) and leadership are unclear.

Oath Keepers is a far-right militant organization operating in the United States. With a focus on recruiting former military and law enforcement personnel, the group seeks to protect Americans from what it perceives as violations of U.S. citizens natural rights by the U.S. federal government. The groups name refers to the oath to defend the Constitution against all enemies, foreign and domestic that is sworn by members of the military and police. Founded in 2009, Oath Keepers (OK) is one of the largest and most prominent organizations of the militia/patriot movement and includes chapters across the country. It is not a white supremacist organization. Members of the group draw heavily on historical memory of the American Revolution, portraying themselves as the heirs of the Founding Fathers and the federal government as a modern-day colonial Great Britain. The group is known for participating in armed standoffs with federal agents in the western United States. In 2016, OK aligned itself with the administration of President Donald Trump and in opposition to the anti-fascist (antifa) movement. OK is politically active, and several members of the organization were elected to public office on the state and local levels. The group played a major role in the storming of the U.S. Capitol on January 6, 2021, to prevent the certification of Joe Bidens victory in the 2020 presidential election.

description: In early February 2021, the North Carolina chapter of Oath Keepers (OK) split from the national OK organization. Doug Smith, the leader of the chapter, announced that the North Carolina Oath Keepers had voted unanimously to break away; he cited OKs involvement in the storming of the U.S. Capitol on January 6 as the catalyst for the decision. Though North Carolina Oath Keepers had attended President Trumps rally on January 6, Smith said that the chapter did not participate in the Capitol riot. Calling the insurrection an ugly stain on our nations history, Smith said that his group would return to its roots of supporting local law enforcement. According to Smith, North Carolina Oath Keepers had begun distancing itself from national leadership as early as November 2020 due to dissatisfaction with OKs response to the results of the 2020 presidential election. As of March 2021, Smith had not announced a new name for his organization. The founding date of the NC Oath Keepers is unknown; 2018 is an estimate.

The Ohio State Regular Militia (OSRM) was an affiliate of Oath Keepers (OK) founded in 2019. Its founder and leader, Jessica Watkins, was a member of OK and claimed that the OSRM has patrolled 12 protests in Ohio and Kentucky since its founding. Watkins allegedly led three members of her militia in traveling from Ohio to Washington D.C. in order to join OK at the riots at the U.S. Capitol on January 6, 2021. In a bid to be released from jail pending trial, Watkins announced in late February 2021 that she was disbanding OSRM.

The Liberty Watch of Josephine County is an Oath Keepers (OK) splinter group that previously operated as the OK chapter for Josephine County, Oregon, beginning in 2012. The group has also gone by the name Citizen Patriots of Josephine County. In April 2015, this chapter captured national attention when it led militants and anti-government activists from across the United States in an armed patrol of Oregons Sugar Pine Mine in defiance of Bureau of Land Management regulations. In August 2016, Rices chapter split from the national Oath Keepers and reorganized as the Citizen Patriots of Josephine County.  By 2017, the group appeared to go by the name Liberty Watch of Josephine County.

The Three Percenters (III%ers) is a far-right militant organization founded in 2008 following the election of President Barack Obama. Considered to be one of the largest umbrella groups in the antigovernment movement, also known as the patriot/militia movement, III%ers coalesces around the incorrect notion that only 3% of the population fought against the British in the American Revolution. The group is highly decentralized; some chapters are organized as militias, while others are non-paramilitary in nature or only maintain an online presence. Prominent subgroups affiliated with the III%er brand include the III% Security Force, the III% United Patriots, the American Patriots III%, the III% Originals, and more. On January 6, 2021, the group played an active role in storming the U.S. Capitol to disrupt the formalization of Joe Bidens victory in the 2020 presidential election.
